intro: Erigeron albidus, commonly known as white fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows, prairies, and disturbed soils. Its white to pale blue flowers bloom in late summer to early autumn, attracting various pollinators. Erigeron albidus is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
